column4: so i just installed a new SATA drive and it's not showing up. can someone tell me how to find and format it?
It should show up on the menu when done.. where I mentioned before.
which disklabel should i use if i just want to use the disk as storage?
you can leave the label blank or call it "storage" if you want.
primary or extended partition? also what filesystem? ext3?

if it's a separate drive then primary and being sata you can use ext3 or ReiserFS.. I found Reiser to be faster on sata drives .. especially if they are larger.  If you want the drive to have compatibility with Windows (after installing the appropriate driver) go with ext3..
i formatted it and restarted and it's still not showing up, ne ideas?
you have to add a line in your /etc/fstab for the system to recognize it on boot. Hang on and I'll get you a line to use..
UUID=put in uuid number here /media/sd?#     ext3    defaults        0       2
you can find what the sd referance is by typing fdisk -l.... then the uuid nmuber by typing blkid
you also have to create a directory called sd?# in /media ... as in.. /media/sdc1
